text.p: RABAT, July 30 Reuter) - These are the leading stories in the Moroccan press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- French Foreign Minister Hubert Vedrine, winding up a two-day visit, told reporters of his country's will to develop open and confident relations with Morocco.
- Interior Minister Driss Basri submits draft laws shaping representation in future parliament to national commission in charge of following up elections.
- French tourism group Club Mediterranee says it plans to expand holiday resorts network in Morocco.
- Two Morocans and an Italian national charged with circulating fake currency.
- Interior Minister Driss Basri proposes to put off general elections to November from September.
- French Foreign Minister Hubert Vedrine's visit aimed at dispelling apprehensions over bilateral relations after the Socialists came to power last month.
